title: Fair Electricity Bill Sharing with Excel (Prepaid Meter + Slabs)
caption: Built a simple but smart Excel sheet to split prepaid electricity bills among multiple families using slab rates.
content:
I recently solved a real-world problem: splitting prepaid electricity bills among 3 families fairly based on sub-meter readings. Instead of building an app, I created a Google Sheet that:

- Calculates unit consumption per family
- Determines the actual cost per unit from net recharge (after VAT)
- Applies government slab-wise billing rules (e.g., 0–50 units @ 4.63 BDT, 51–75 @ 5.26 BDT, etc.)
- Uses Excel formulas like `=MAX(0, (MIN(end, slab_to) - slab_from) * rate)` to dynamically calculate charges slab by slab

The total always matches the net recharge amount, and the result is clean and fair for everyone involved. This is a great example of how powerful spreadsheets can be for everyday finance problems without needing to write code!
